conclusion: Average velocity is calculated by dividing displacement by time.
Displacement is the straight line distance from A to C, which is the diameter of the circle.
Direction of displacement is from A to C, which is southward.
Average speed is calculated by dividing total distance traveled by time.
Total distance traveled is the sum of the lengths of the two semi-circular arcs.
Total distance is 2 x πR = 2 x π x 1m = 2πm.
Final answer: Average velocity is 0.4m/s southward, and average speed is 0.4πm/s.
